title: Launcher Background Noise
body:
Anybody else get terrible headaches from all the background 'wooshy' noises the launcher makes? The background noise after hitting the accept button for queue, in particular, is exceptionally headache inducing. 

What's with all the noise? Can't we just have a nice quiet launcher that sits in the background and only makes notification sounds when queues hit?

It could just be me though. Posting to find out.

replies.body: The options menu (in Client > Sounds) has an overall "Enable Sound" option, which handles all sounds the client makes. Within that, there's "Enable SFX," which includes "Play Ambient Sounds" (like a slight breeze that continues at all times including during games and didn't originally have an option to disable but now it does), "Play Pick Quotes," and "Play Ban Quotes." Individual sound effects like accepting a queue would be part of "Enable SFX," so if you wanted to disable that sound, it would take with it ambient noise, voice lines (within the client, not the game itself), and all the other little noises the client can make.

The annoying background sounds are lumped together with the notification sounds under the general term "SFX" turning off "Ambient Sounds" takes care of most of the 'wooshing' and other headache inducing noise, but it doesn't get rid of the "Accept Button" after sounds which are totally unnecessary. That is, unless you want to turn off all sounds and just miss your queues when the launcher decides to not jump up in front of your face every other time someone dodges.

Edit: Also, every time there's a launcher update, all these settings are reset.
No headache here, but upvoted because sound is too "hyped".
